text: i’m just starting your videos now but even the snippet of the stretchy text demo from the start reminded me immediately of <@USJ899UUD> ‘s work called <http://symbolflux.com/projects/tiledtext|TiledText>. I think a lot of his work shares some overlap. i love your style of visualization so far and am excited to dig in!

text: Hi <@U01NQ4945N1> —just wanted to say I loved the stretchy code map video! I think altering sizes as in your demo is a compelling concept for more efficient code comprehension. <@UHWC9PXBL> is correct that there is some overlap in my Tiled Text project, though I was trying to solve a different problem (efficiently navigating/manipulating structured text with low-precision/low unique-symbol-count input devices). The way my system was structured would make it easy to render text at varying sizes as a function of tree depth—but it leaves a number of questions open-ended about practically editing programs, and the code is a nightmare jumble of 10 year old java. Looking forward to seeing more of your videos!
